titles.title: Cardfight!! Vanguard
カードファイト!! ヴァンガード
CARDFIGHT!! ヴァンガード
Cardfight Vanguard
卡片战斗先导者

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr6287 [Bushiroad]`s Collectible Card Game by the same name. The protagonist of this story, Sendo Aichi, is a timid boy in his third year of middle school. He had been living his life looking backward rather than forward, trying not to stand out. However, he had one thing that kept him going - the Blaster Blade, a card from a card game that was given to him when he was little. That card is the reason why he begins to engage in Card Fights, something that changes his life drastically. The name of the card game is Vanguard. The game takes place in a different planet called Klay, and due to a never before seen play system, it becomes popular throughout the world. http://anidb.net/ch25900 [Aichi], immediately attracted by Vanguard, meets friends such as http://anidb.net/ch25902 [Togura Misaki] and http://anidb.net/ch25903 [Katsuragi Kamui], along with other rivals. Through friendly rivalry with them, Aichi begins to enjoy a fulfilling life. Aichi, however, has a goal: to once again battle with a Vanguard Fighter by the name of http://anidb.net/ch25901 [Kai Toshiki]. Kai is an aloof and cold-hearted high schooler who has outstanding abilities in the world of Vanguard. He is also the reason why Aichi started playing the game. For him, Toshiki is the person who saved him from his boring life and introduced him to Vanguard. In order to get better at Vanguard, Aichi puts his soul into it every day. He wishes that someday, he will be able to battle Toshiki and have him recognise his worth. Source: CrunchyRoll

externalentity.identifier: カードファイト!!_ヴァンガード_(アニメ)

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: Greek mythology
tag.description: The anime is derived or draws elements from the Greek mythology, and as such features some mythological characteristics of Ancient Greece. Those may be creatures, such as the Centaur or Hydra, tales, such as that of the Trojan War, or even the Gods themselves, like Zeus or Poseidon. More subtle references also count, such as the careful usage of names of places or people that hold significance in the myths.

tag.name: serious business
tag.description: For some people it is just a card- or board game. For others it is not just a matter of life and death — it is much more important than that. Serious business basically describes a situation, when a show revolves around an activity where a sizeable portion of the in-series population takes it far more seriously than it should. If something`s popularity rivals that of Elvis, or if there are mainstream schools devoted to it instead of teaching reading, writing, and arithmetic; it is serious business.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

character.name: Hercule Burton
character.description: Hercules Barton is a very shy girl, named after Hercule Poirot, who is easily embarrassed. Her Toy gives her superhuman strength.

character.name: Cordelia Glauca
character.description: Cordelia is a blonde girl who often gets delusional concerning the relationship within the group, named after Cordelia Gray. She tends to get rather delusional whenever she is scared. Her Toy allows her to see and hear things others cannot.

character.name: Sherlock Shellinford
character.description: Sherlock Sherringford is the leader of Milky Holmes, named after Sherlock Holmes. She`s known to be particularly clumsy but is always caring. Her Toy gives her telekinesis.

character.name: Yuzurizaki Nero
character.description: Yuzurizaki Nero is an obnoxious girl with a hefty appetite, named after Nero Wolfe. She speaks with the masculine term boku. Her Toy allows her to control machines.

character.name: Ma no Kaiiki no Ou Basskirk
Akumu no Kuni no Dark Queen
Akumu no Kuni no March Rabbit

episode.title: 運命の先導者(ヴァンガード)!!
Vanguard of Destiny!!
Vanguard Do Destino!
Unmei no Vanguard!!
episode.summary: The main character is a third year middle school student who is a slight coward named Aichi Sendou. The days pass by, and because of that part of his personality, he doesn`t make many friends. But Aichi has one thing which supports him. A single card he got when he was little named "Blaster Blade". It`s actually a very valuable card from the card game that is sweeping the world in popularity named "Vanguard". But one day, a loud and violent classmate of his named Morikawa steals the card from him by force... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 猛攻! ツインドライブ
Assault! Twin Drive
Moukou! Twin Drive
episode.summary: Aichi wishes he could fight once again with Kai, who he looks up to. But the manager of Card Capital, Shin Nitta, stops him. He says that he`s got a better idea, and has Aichi fight with his niece, Misaki. Misaki knows the rules, but has never had a Vanguard fight before herself. What could Shin`s real aim be? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ようこそ! カードキャピタルへ
Welcome to Card Capital
Bem-Vindo À Card Capital!
Youkoso! Card Capital e
episode.summary: Aichi`s little sister, Emi, finds it strange that Aichi seems to be having more fun lately, as he usually lives out his life being bored... One day, on her way home from school, Emi sees some bad-looking guys taking Achi away somewhere. Worried, Emi follows them, and arrives at a store named "Card Capital". Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝利へのライド
Ride to Victory
Ride Da Vitória!
Shouri e no Ride
episode.summary: In order to take back his precious card "Blaster Blade", Aichi continues his fight with Kai. Even as he explains the rules while he fights, Aichi can sense Kai`s overwhelming strength. Aichi fights back with all his strength, and during their fierce back and forth their surprising history together is revealed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決着! ショップ大会
The End of the Shop Tournament!
Kecchaku! Shop Taikai
episode.summary: Aichi challenges Kamui, trying to get revenge for his previous loss. Since their last fight, the gap in their skills has closed considerably. Aichi puts everything he`s got out there in order to reach that fight with Kai he`s aiming for. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイチVSカムイ
Aichi vs. Kamui
Aichi VS Kamui
episode.summary: It`s already the semi-finals of the Shop Tournament and standing up against Aichi is none other than Kamui! As the fight begins Aichi and Kamui don`t hold back one bit, going at each other with full force! With that invigorating tension, they battle on! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忍者ファイター, 退場
Ninja Fighter Withdraws
Ninja Fighter, Taijou
episode.summary: Aichi continues getting his hands dirty in a fight with the mysterious Ninja Master in the second round of the Shop Tournament. Using the skills of his "Nubatama" deck, the ninja backs Aichi into a corner! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忍者ファイター, 参上
Enter the Ninja Fighter
Ninja Fighter, Sanjou
episode.summary: With the first round over, the Shop Tournament is really starting to heat up! There`s a fight that`s drawing everyone`s attention, between a middle schooler and an adult dressed as a ninja who is trying to defeat him! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ショップ大会開幕
The Shop Tournament Begins
Shop Taikai Kaimaku
episode.summary: Aichi is participating in the Shop Tournament held at Card Capital. The usual gang is there, plus a bunch of unusual folks... But Aichi`s gaze is focused only on one place... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 騎士王, 出陣!
The King of Knights Enters the Fray!
Kishi Ou, Shutsujin!
episode.summary: Aichi is trying to decide whether to enter Card Capital`s upcoming Shop Tournament, but is worried that he isn`t good enough to compete. He finds himself coming to the shop anyway, and there`s only two spots left! Just then, Kai walks in, and submits his entry form. Knowing that he might get to fight Kai if he enters, Aichi leaps at the chance, but just before he enters, another person sneaks in their application at the same time! There`s only one spot left in the tournament, so there`s only one way to settle this: An on-the-spot fight! Aichi is full of motivation, but can he defeat an opponent who seems to have accounted for everything? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦慄のソウルブラスト
The Fearsome Soulblast
Senritsu no Soul Blast
episode.summary: Shin gets a brand new "Standing Fight" table for his shop, and so to test it out, Morikawa and Kamui have a fight. Afterwards, Aichi and Kamui notice Kai walking about town, and decide to follow him to see where he lives now. Kai notices, and Kamui challenges him to a fight. Kai senses a strong opponent, and agrees to the challenge, but does Kamui really know what he`s getting into? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 謎のカードショップ
The Mysterious Card Shop
Nazo no Card Shop
episode.summary: Aichi, Morikawa, and Izaki go into the city to a card shop. Aichi is all excited about his first time in another card shop than Card Capital. It`s then that Morikawa gets lost, and they can`t find the shop. Right when they`re about to give up, before Aichi`s eyes there appears an extremely mysterious card shop... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 旋風! 小学生ファイターカムイ
Whirlwind! Kamui, the Grade-School Fighter
Tsujikaze! Shougakusei Fighter Kamui
episode.summary: One day, when Aichi pops his head into Card Capital, Morikawa is fighting a kid he`s never seen before. The kid is so powerful, Morikawa can`t even scratch him. His name is Kamui Katsuragi, and he`s a famous grade-school fighter in the area. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 不死の恐怖! グランブルーデッキ
The Fearsome Undead! A Granblue Deck!
Fushi no Kyoufu! Grand Blue Deck
episode.summary: Aichi heads out on a journey to other card shops, in order to find and fight other strong Vanguard fighters and gain experience after the Shop Tournament. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たなる仲間たち
New Allies
Aratanaru Chuugen-tachi
episode.summary: It`s the first round of the regional tournament and Aichi, who has never been in one before, is completely taken in by the atmosphere and can`t play to his normal level. Then, "Three Blacks" swoop in to stand in his way! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チームQ4(キューフォー), 地区大会へ
Team Q4 Heads for the Regional Tournament!
Team Q4, Chiku Taikai e
episode.summary: The Regional Tournament is finally starting! Aichi and the gang get in Shin`s van and head to the tournament hall. When they reach it, Aichi is amazed at the size and starts to feel the pressure bearing down... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハラハラ!? エミの初ファイト
Thrilling!? Emi`s First Fight!
Harahara!? Emi no Hatsu Fight
episode.summary: Emi starts taking an interest in Vanguard because of Aichi. One day while visiting Card Capital, Shin gets Emi to participate in a Vanguard fight for the first time! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 白熱のトーナメント!
White-Hot Tournament!
Hakunetsu no Tournament!
episode.summary: The regional tournament is heating up even more after the winners of the first round are decided! Unique and quirky teams all stand up before Team Q4 to fight and win! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決勝での再戦!!
Rematch in the Final Match!!
Kesshou de no Saisen!!
episode.summary: Aichi`s fight with Gouki begins with the tournament on the line! Aichi stands up to Gouki, fighting for his team and to avenge his previous loss! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 秘められたメッセージ
The Hidden Message
Himerareta Message
episode.summary: The curtain falls on the first showdown, and the middle fight of the finals begins! Up for Team Q4 is Toshiki Kai, and up for Team Handsome is Kaoru. It dawns on Aichi that the result of his fight will mean the difference between victory and defeat! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦! ノヴァグラップラー!
Showdown! Nova Grappler
Kessen! Nova Grappler!
episode.summary: Kamui wants to show Gouki, the guiding star of the Vanguard world, how strong he`s gotten. But first up for "Team Handsom" is...!? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 舞い降りた聖龍
The Holy Dragon Descends
Maiorita Seiryuu
episode.summary: The final fight of the regional tournament reaches its pulse-pounding conclusion! If Aichi wins, Team Q4 will go to Nationals! But if he`s beaten by the swashbuckling captain of Team Handsome, Aichi`s team not only loses, but Kamui will apparently be forced to wed Nagisa! And what is the weird sensation that comes over Aichi at the climax of the fight?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 波乱の幕開け! 全国大会!!
A Stormy Beginning! The National Championship!
Haran no Makuake! Zenkoku Taikai!!
episode.summary: Finally, the curtain rises on the Vanguard National Championship Tournament! Team Q4 had come together as one, but faced with their dream competition and the huge odds against them, cracks start forming between them... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 記憶の先に
Beyond Memories
Kioku no Saki ni
episode.summary: Aichi and the others are scrambling, at a loss, not knowing the reason Misaki suddenly tells them "I can no longer fight together with you". Worried about her brother, Emi visits Card Capital and... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 消せない記憶
The Indelible Memory
Kesenai Kioku
episode.summary: Continuing to train in preparation for the national tournament, Aichi and the others notice Misaki`s incredible memory. Aichi and Kamui are all excited to learn how to have such great memory ability, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命の出会い
Fateful Encounter
Unmai no Deai
episode.summary: After getting through to the National Tournament, Aichi and the others head to the mysterious card shop PSY that they once visited in order to polish their skills. But what awaits them there... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最強チーム AL4!
The Strongest Team, AL4!
Saikyou Team, AL4!
episode.summary: It`s the final match-up in the qualifying league, and the third opponent to face off against Team Q4. But it`s none other than last year`s champion team, and the ones favored to win it all this year too, Team AL4! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 月, 満ちるとき
When the Moon is Full
Tsuki, Michiru Toki
episode.summary: The second matchup for Team Q4 in the preliminary rounds of the National Tournament is Team Muscle Brain who uses Nova Grappler decks. The tough battles continue... What is the path to victory? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 猛進! たちかぜデッキ!!
Aggressive Advancement! Tachikaze Deck!
Moushin! Tachi Kaze Deck!!
episode.summary: The first match of the preliminaries is heating up, with offense and defense continuing for Aichi vs. Ryudou Genji. Genji`s "Tachikaze" deck specializes in a fearsome power where you can sacrifice your allies to eliminate your opponents... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジュラシックアーミー
Jurassic Army
Jurassic Army
episode.summary: In the qualifying leagues of the national tournament, Team Q4`s first match is decided to be against a team called the "Jurassic Army". Who will be standing against Aichi, nervous in his lead-off position? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夏だ! 合宿だ! ヴァンガードだ!
It`s Summer! It`s Camp! It`s Vanguard!
Natsu Da! Gasshuku Da! Vanguard Da!
episode.summary: Team Q4 and friends have a Vanguard training camp at a beach, but they`re surprised to meet the powerful team that actually invited them. Will Aichi and his teammates actually learn and improve, or be distracted by fun-in-the-sun beach activities?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 漆黒のブラスター
Blaster of Darkness
Shikkoku no Blaster
episode.summary: It`s the last match of the National Vanguard Championship Finals! The long-awaited Ren Suzugamori of Team AL4 arrives on the scene and in his fight, unleases a unit that no one`s ever seen before! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔界の将軍
Demon World General
Makai no Shougun
episode.summary: The final fight with Team AL4 is here at last. Aichi is pitted against Tetsu Shinjou, a fearsome opponent nicknamed the "General". Aichi brings all of his accumulated experience to the fore, but is it enough against a fighter who boasts overwhelming strength? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 美しきアサシン
Beautiful Assassin
Utsukushiki Assassin
episode.summary: The first battle with Team AL4 is over, and the fight moves into the middle round, between Team Q4`s Misaki and Team AL4`s Asaka. How skilled really is Asaka, known as the "Assassin"? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 合宿の成果
Results of the Training Camp
Gasshuku no Seika
episode.summary: Kamui subjects Aichi and the others to a rigorous "special training" regimen at camp, but it doesn`t do anything to help Aichi prepare a "winning deck". For that, Aichi seems to get a hand... from the cards themselves?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 裏ファイトの王
The King of Underground Fights
Ura Fight no Ou
episode.summary: Dissatisfied with the training camp, Kai goes to the wrong side of the tracks for an edgier kind of Cardfight. Kai gets what he wants and then some, going up against the King of Underground Fights, with Miwa as a hostage! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地区大会, 再び
Return to Regionals
Chiku Taikai, Futatabi
episode.summary: The reigning regional champions, Team Q4, return to the tournament that propelled them to nationals. The bar is higher than before, with strong new teams poised to take the crown and Team Handsome determined to win it back! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 三和(みわ)の実力
Miwa`s Ability
Miwa no Jitsuryoku
episode.summary: The members of Q4 aim to get another shot at the national championship, but it looks like their hopes will be dashed at the Card Capital Shop Tournament, when Aichi fights Miwa, Kai`s old fighting partner. This one match will decide which team goes to regionals, Q4 or the upstart Team Overthrow! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 帰ってきた忍者マスター
The Return of the Ninja Master
Kaette Kita Ninja Master
episode.summary: Card Capital is hosting another tournament, this time for teams. Team Q4 makes short work of the other players, but then they go up against Team Overthrow. The players are familiar and seem to be pushovers, but Overthrow has a couple of secret weapons up its sleeve! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 危険な匂い
Dangerous Scent
Kiken na Nioi
episode.summary: In the first round of the regional tournament, Q4 fights Perfume, the team that can smell their every move! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒い先導者
The Black Vanguard
Kuroi Sendousha
episode.summary: Ren Suzugamori gives Aichi a Shadow Paladin deck, saying it will make him stronger. But Kourin challenges him with a Royal Paladin deck of her own, to prove that no deck can make a Fighter stronger. Will Aichi be taught a lesson or will the new deck bring out his dark side even more? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: PSYクオリア
Psyqualia
Psyqualia
episode.summary: In the last round of the regional championship, Aichi`s battle with Kyou rages on! But his friends and teammates begin to get concerned, as it seems something strange has gotten into Aichi... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復讐のキョウ
Kyou`s Revenge
Fukushuu no Kyou
episode.summary: To get revenge against Ren and AL4 for kicking them off the team, Crusher Kyou and his Avengers first have to beat Team Q4 at regionals! But Aichi, cocky for the first time, tells Kyou in no uncertain terms that that isn`t going to happen! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 予期せぬ来客
Unexpected Visitor
Yokisenu Raikyaku
episode.summary: fter her defeat at the hands of a power-mad Aichi, Kourin seeks out Kai on the eve of the national tournament. She finds him playing Vanguard in a back alley and challenges him to a fight. But what does Kourin really want from Kai and why is she so angry? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シャドウパラディン
Shadow Paladin
Shadow Paladin
episode.summary: The next Vanguard National Championship begins here! Spurred on by Ren, Team Foo Fighter Brilliant Stars has targeted Aichi -- but first, the one-time mild-mannered fighter has to survive his encounter with the Jurassic Army, who he lost against last time around! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絡みつく糸
The Coiling Thread
Karamitsuku Ito
episode.summary: With Aichi laid up in the infirmary after his latest post-game spell, it`s up to Kamui and Misaki to get through the elimination round. But their first effort as a duo is against Spyder, the team that knows all about them, including their Achilles Heel! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: もう一つのフーファイター
Another Foo Fighter
Mouhitotsu no Foo Fighter
episode.summary: Kamui and Misaki both fight desperately against members of the Brilliant Stars, AL4`s strongest "farm team". If they fail, it means Aichi has to fight, which could lead to him getting sicker as well as being engulfed further by the dark side. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 孤独なファイト
Solitary Fight
Kodoku na Fight
episode.summary: It`s Dark Paladin Aichi versus Bidou, the candidate for the open position of AL4! Will Aichi finally be knocked off his high horse by a fighter who`s even stronger than Crusher Kyou?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 櫂の戦い
Kai`s Battle
Kai no Tatakai
episode.summary: Kai arranges a fight with the power-mad Aichi before it`s too late. As the two square off in an alley, Kai recalls the last time he encountered the power of Psyqualia... years before, when he was Ren`s friend and teammate! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦いの果てに・・・
Beyond the Battle
Tatakai no Hate ni...
episode.summary: The back-alley battle between Aichi and Kai comes to a pulse-pounding conclusion! It`s the moment Aichi`s been waiting for, but is this the fight he really wants? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黄金の輝き
Golden Glow
Ougon no Kagayaki
episode.summary: Aichi goes to Card Capital to apologize to everyone about what a jerk he`s been, only to find a shop tournament going on. Aichi participates to get back in the swing of things, but the miracle of the day is Morikawa, whose delusions of grandeur have suddenly come true, as he beats opponent after opponent! Now that he`s no longer under the sway of Psyqualia, does Aichi even stand a chance?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 洋上の歌姫
Songstress of the Sea
Youjou no Utahime
episode.summary: At the Card Capital shop tournament, while Aichi gets back into his groove, Morikawa is still on a winning streak! Meanwhile, Kamui is in a jealous rage because Reiji is fighting his "goddess", Emi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 開戦! 決勝トーナメント
The Battle Begins! Tournament Finals
Kaisen! Kesshou Tournament
episode.summary: The Tournament Finals begin, and Team Q4`s goal is defeating Ren`s Team AL4, but they`ll have to face the other strongest teams from around the country first, including their friends in Team Caesar! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 剣闘士(グラディエーター)
Gladiator
Gladiator
episode.summary: Team Q4 battles the powerful Team Caesar in the semifinals! First up is Kamui versus the "Gladiator", who`ll do everything in his power to protect the "Emperor"! Then it`s Misaki`s turn against the "Empress", who`s no longer playing nice! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カエサルの女帝
Caesar`s Empress
Caesar no Jotei
episode.summary: The epic battle between Misaki and the "Empress" of Team Caesar concludes here! Misaki is great at memorizing cards, but Yuri seems intent on teaching her that there`s more to winning a Vanguard fight than relying on probabilities. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 皇帝と呼ばれる男
The Man They Call "The Emperor"
Koutei to Yobareru Otoko
episode.summary: Aichi is in the middle of the most challenging match of his life against Kenji Mitsusada, the "Emperor", a former national Vanguard champion! While Aichi is on the ropes, Ren tries to bring him back to the side of Psyqualia and a guaranteed win. Can Aichi stick to his guns, even if it means losing the match and a chance to fight Ren?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宿命の対決
Fateful Showdown
Shukumei no Taiketsu
episode.summary: We finally learn how and why Ren received his power, Psyqualia! Then, only hours away from the final round of the national tournament, Kai challenges Ren to a desperate battle. Kai was able to bring Aichi back from the dark side of Psyqualia. Can he do the same for Ren... or is it too late?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激突! オーバーロード
Clash! Overlord
Gekitotsu! Overlord
episode.summary: Kai`s desperate battle with Ren continues! Kai has brought out his ultimate card, Dragonic Overlord The End, but Ren also has an ace in the hole! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 頂点の座を賭けて
Fighting for the Top Spot
Chouten no Za o Kakete
episode.summary: The final round of the Vanguard National Championship Finals Tournament begins at last! The first match is between Kamui and Tetsu "The General" Shinjou, but Tetsu seems distracted. Will Kamui be able to earn the attention, respect, and maybe even victory from AL4`s number two fighter?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 将軍の壁
Wall of the General
Shougun no Kabe
episode.summary: Can Kamui break through the wall of Team AL4`s General?! He has skill, a great deck, and teammates who are behind him all the way, but is it enough? What if Kamui breaks his promise to Emi and loses?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: フーファイターへの想い
Feelings Towards Foo Fighter
Foo Fighter e no Omoi
episode.summary: The rematch between Asaka`s fearsome Pale Moon circus and Misaki`s Oracle Think Tank rages on, and it`s a fight that neither of them can afford to lose. Meanwhile, Asaka`s backstory is finally revealed, from her very first day at Foo Fighter and first meeting with Ren! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ファイトの支配者
Lord of the Fight
Fight no Shihaisha
episode.summary: It`s the "final act" of the battle between Asaka with her Pale Moon Circus and Misaki! The last time they fought, Asaka was two steps ahead of Misaki`s game, but what about now? If Misaki doesn`t avenge herself here, AL4 wins the championship yet again! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 並び立つ能力者
Two Powers, Side-by-Side
Narabitatsu Nouryokusha
episode.summary: The decisive battle between Aichi and Ren is here at last! Both of them have the power of Psyqualia, but Aichi refuses to use his because he doesn`t want to lose himself again. Is Aichi strong enough to even last long against Ren, who has no such qualms about using the power? Or will Aichi give in to Psyqualia`s siren call...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: PSYクオリアの真実
The Truth of Psyqualia
Psyqualia no Shinjitsu
episode.summary: The final battle for the national championship continues between Aichi and Ren! What happens when they use Psyqualia at the same time?! Can Aichi be saved a second time or will his darker side take control for good?! Also, learn the true purpose of Psyqualia and the role of those who wield it! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 目覚めし双剣
Awakening of Twin Blades
Mezameshi Souken
episode.summary: The season finale brings the conclusion to Aichi and Ren`s epic Cardfight! For them, it`s a matter of which team is going to win the national championship, but little do they know that the outcome is tied in to the fate of the real planet Cray! Source: crunchyroll
